Title: musl: x87 floating-point stack adjustment imbalance
Synopsis:
An x87 stack handling error in musl might allow an attacker to have
    an application dependent impact.

Background.Text: musl is an implementation of the C standard library built on top of the Linux system call API, including interfaces defined in the base language standard, POSIX, and widely agreed-upon extensions.

Description.Text: A flaw in musl libcâ€™s arch-specific math assembly code for i386 was found which can lead to x87 stack overflow in the execution of subsequent math code.

Impact.Text: Impact depends on how the application built against musl libc handles the ABI-violating x87 state.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All musl users should upgrade to the latest version:
